info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 26 at 1:44PM AKST until November 28 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Wintry mix of snow, freezing rain, and rain expected. Total snow accumulation up to one inch. Ice accumulation of a glaze up to a tenth of an inch.
* WHERE...Sterling Highway between Cooper Landing and Sterling, including Jean Lake.
* WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 3 AM AKST Friday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the holiday travel.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A light wintry mix of precipitation will develop late tonight and continue through Thursday. Precipitation may begin as a period of light snow, but is expected to transition to light freezing rain Thursday morning as temperatures climb to around freezing. Temperatures may climb above freezing Thursday afternoon as easterly winds increase. Any rain on frozen surfaces may create hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM AKST FRIDAY
